intro: Bupleurum rigescens, commonly known as rigid valerian, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its fern-like leaves and umbel-shaped flower clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pale green to white, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Bupleurum rigescens is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
